definition:
The concept of a squarefree number can be generalized. Let
$n \in \mathbb{Z}$ with $n>1$. Then $m \in \mathbb{Z}$ is [*$n$-free*]{}
if, for any prime $p$, $p^n$ does not divide $m$.

Let $S$ denote the set of all squarefree natural numbers. Note that, for
any $n$ and any positive $n$-free integer $m$, there exists a unique
$(a_1, \dots , a_{n-1}) \in S^{n-1}$ with $\gcd(a_i,a_j)=1$ for
$i \neq j$ such that $\displaystyle m=\prod_{j=1}^{n-1} {a_j}^j$.
